Proverbs__03.1: My son, forget not my law, and let thy heart keep my commandments.
Proverbs__03.2: For they shall add to thee length of days, and years of life and peace.
Proverbs__03.3: Let not mercy and truth leave thee, put them about thy neck, and write them in the tables of thy heart:
Proverbs__03.4: And thou shalt find grace and good understanding before God and men.
Proverbs__03.5: Have confidence in the Lord with all thy heart, and lean not upon thy own prudence.
Proverbs__03.6: In all thy ways think on him, and he will direct thy steps.
Proverbs__03.7: Be not wise in thy own conceit: fear God, and depart from evil:
Proverbs__03.8: For it shall be health to thy navel, and moistening to thy bones.
Proverbs__03.9: Honour the Lord with thy substance, and give him of the first of all thy fruits:
Proverbs__03.10: And thy barns shall be filled with abundance, and thy presses shall run over with wine.
Proverbs__03.11: My son, reject not the correction of the Lord: and do not faint when thou art chastised by him:
Proverbs__03.12: For whom the Lord loveth, he chastiseth: and as a father in the son he pleaseth himself.
Proverbs__03.13: Blessed is the man that findeth wisdom and is rich in prudence:
Proverbs__03.14: The purchasing thereof is better than the merchandise of silver, and her fruit than the chiefest and purest gold:
Proverbs__03.15: She is more precious than all riches: and all the things that are desired, are not to be compared with her.
Proverbs__03.16: Length of days is in her right hand, and in her left hand riches and glory.
Proverbs__03.17: Her ways are beautiful ways, and all her paths are peaceable.
Proverbs__03.18: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold on her: and he that shall retain her is blessed.
Proverbs__03.19: The Lord by wisdom hath founded the earth, hath established the heavens by prudence.
Proverbs__03.20: By his wisdom the depths have broken out, and the clouds grow thick with dew.
Proverbs__03.21: My son, let not these things depart from thy eyes: keep the law and counsel:
Proverbs__03.22: And there shall be life to thy soul, and grace to thy mouth.
Proverbs__03.23: Then shalt thou walk confidently in thy way, and thy foot shall not stumble:
Proverbs__03.24: If thou sleep, thou shalt not fear: thou shalt rest, and thy sleep shall be sweet.
Proverbs__03.25: Be not afraid of sudden fear, nor of the power of the wicked falling upon thee.
Proverbs__03.26: For the Lord will be at thy side, and will keep thy foot that thou be not taken.
Proverbs__03.27: Do not withhold him from doing good, who is able: if thou art able, do good thyself also.
Proverbs__03.28: Say not to thy friend: Go, and come again: and tomorrow I will give to thee: when thou canst give at present.
Proverbs__03.29: Practise not evil against thy friend, when he hath confidence in thee.
Proverbs__03.30: Strive not against a man without cause, when he hath done thee no evil.
Proverbs__03.31: Envy not the unjust man, and do not follow his ways:
Proverbs__03.32: For every mocker is an abomination to the Lord, and his communication is with the simple.
Proverbs__03.33: Want is from the Lord in the house of the wicked: but the habitations of the just shall be blessed.
Proverbs__03.34: He shall scorn the scorners, and to the meek he will give grace.
Proverbs__03.35: The wise shall possess glory: the promotion of fools is disgrace.
